org.openimaj.math.geometry.point

Interface Coordinate

  • All Superinterfaces:
    Readable, ReadableASCII, ReadableBinary, ReadWriteable, Writeable, WriteableASCII, WriteableBinary
    All Known Subinterfaces:
    Location, Point2d, Point3d, ScaleSpacePoint
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    AbstractPoint2d, AffineInterestPointKeypoint, AffineSimulationKeypoint, AffineSimulationKeypoint.AffineSimulationKeypointLocation, ByteDSIFTKeypoint, CircularInterestPointKeypoint, DoublePoint2dImpl, EllipticInterestPointData, Feature, FloatDSIFTKeypoint, FloatKeypoint, FValuePixel, GenericValuePixel, InterestPointData, InterestPointKeypoint, IntValuePixel, Keypoint, KeypointLocation, MinMaxKeypoint, MinMaxKeypoint.MinMaxKeypointLocation, PayloadCoordinate, Pixel, Point2dImpl, Point3dImpl, QuantisedKeypoint, ScaleSpaceLocation, SIFTGeoKeypoint.SIFTGeoLocation, SpatialLocation, ValuePixel

    public interface Coordinate
extends ReadWriteable
    Generic interface to get the distance along a dimension of an object representing a point in an n-dimensional space
    Author:
    Jonathon Hare (jsh2@ecs.soton.ac.uk)

    • Method Detail

      • getOrdinate

        Number getOrdinate(int dimension)
        Get the ordinate value for a specific dimension.
        Parameters:
        dimension - The index of the dimension we are interested in
        Returns:
        The value of the ordinate of the given dimension.
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - if the Coordinate does not support the dimension.

      • setOrdinate

        void setOrdinate(int dimension,
                 Number value)
        Set the ordinate value for a specific dimension.
        Parameters:
        dimension - The index of the dimension we are interested in
        value - The value of the ordinate of the given dimension.
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - if the Coordinate does not support the dimension.

      • getDimensions

        int getDimensions()
        Returns:
        The number of dimensions in the coordinate.
